thread.title_full: 650,000 Britax strollers recalled after accidents Yahoo7 Be - Yahoo7

author: Allison Yee
title: 650,000 Britax strollers recalled after accidents Yahoo7 Be - Yahoo7
text:
Share 650,000 Britax strollers recalled after accidents Yahoo7 Be - Yahoo7 
You trust it to keep your baby safe when you’re on the go, but now a huge recall of two kinds of Britax strollers has left parents around the world shaken and concerned. Close Over 650,000 Strollers Are Recalled After Infant Accidents UP NEXT 
RELATED: Lululemon recalls face-slapping tops 
The company issued the recall after 33 reported incidents where the car seat component was attached to the stroller, only to suddenly disconnect and fall to the ground. The B-Agile stroller with click and go receiver is one of the models that has been recalled. Photo: Instagram/alecia604 
In 26 of these cases, parents reported scratches, bruises and cuts to their little ones. 
“A damaged receiver mount on the stroller can cause the car seat to disengage and fall unexpectedly, posing a fall hazard to infants in the car seat,” reports the CPSC. 
According to Britax Australia “New Zealand is conducting a recall on Britax B-Motion and Bob Motion strollers, the Britax Click & Go 3 Wheel Stroller frame and Britax Click & Go receivers when used as a Travel system with the B-Safe Infant car seat. With nearly 30 cases of children being injured, the company has issued a widespread recall. Photo: Getty images 
However, if you have purchased your stroller in Australia, you can rest easy.. 
“The Britax Australia Infant Carriers are a different design and do not have a propensity to disconnect from the Click & Go receivers,” writes the company on their Aussie Facebook site. 
“Britax Australia has had no incidence of Infant Carriers being disconnected from the strollers and have not had any returns of failed Click & Go Receivers.” Close Dogs In Prams Is Hong Kong's Newest Trend UP NEXT VIDEO Dogs in prams is Hong Kong's newest trend. Source: Caters Dogs In Prams Is Hong Kong's Newest Trend
